alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 16 at 5:45PM MST until November 17 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds 10 to 20 mph with higher gusts in channeled areas are also expected to develop by early Thursday morning. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan, Bitterroot Valley, Missoula, Highway 93 Sula to Lost Trail Pass, and Lolo Pass. * WHEN...From 9 PM Wednesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys
